# deferredCanceled

**Type Property**

A constant that indicates your app or the location manager canceled the request for deferred updates.

## Declaration

```swift
static var deferredCanceled: CLError.Code { get }
```

## Discussion

This error is returned if you call the [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocationManager/disallowDeferredLocationUpdates()] method or schedule a new deferred update before the previous deferred update request is processed. The location manager may also report this error too. For example, if the app is in the foreground when a new location is determined, the location manager cancels deferred updates and delivers the location data to your app.

## Getting deferred location update errors

- **deferredFailed**: A constant that indicates the location manager didn’t enter deferred mode for an unknown reason.
- **deferredAccuracyTooLow**: A constant that indicates deferred mode isn’t supported for the requested accuracy.
- **deferredDistanceFiltered**: A constant that indicates deferred mode doesn’t support distance filters.
- **deferredNotUpdatingLocation**: A constant that indicates the location manager didn’t enter deferred mode because location updates were already disabled or paused.
